Detailed Description

Creates Bitmap objects from various sources, including files, streams, and byte-arrays.

Member Function Documentation

static Bitmap* gaia::graphics::BitmapFactory::decodeByteArrayN ( const base::ByteArray &  data,
size_t  offset,
size_t  length,
Options *  opts 
) [static]

Decode an immutable bitmap from the specified byte array.

If the array cannot be decoded into a bitmap, the function returns NULL.

The caller should delete the returned object to release the allocated memory when the object is not used anymore.

Parameters:
databyte array of compressed image data
offsetoffset into imageData for where the decoder should begin parsing.
lengththe number of bytes, beginning at offset, to parse
optsNULL-ok; Options that control downsampling and whether the image should be completely decoded, or just is size returned.
Returns:
The decoded bitmap, or NULL if the image data could not be decoded, or, if opts is non-NULL and requested only the size be returned (in opts's outWidth and opts's outHeight)
static Bitmap* gaia::graphics::BitmapFactory::decodeByteArrayN ( const base::ByteArray &  data,
size_t  offset,
size_t  length 
) [static]

Decode an immutable bitmap from the specified byte array.

The caller should delete the returned object to release the allocated memory when the object is not used anymore.

Parameters:
databyte array of compressed image data
offsetoffset into imageData for where the decoder should begin parsing.
lengththe number of bytes, beginning at offset, to parse
Returns:
The decoded bitmap, or NULL if the image data could not be decoded.
static Bitmap* gaia::graphics::BitmapFactory::decodeFileDescriptorN ( const storage::FileDescriptor &  fd,
Rect *  outPadding,
Options *  opts 
) [static]

Decode a bitmap from the file descriptor.

If the bitmap cannot be decoded, the function returns NULL. The position within the descriptor will not be changed when this returns, so the descriptor can be used again as-is.

The caller should delete the returned object to release the allocated memory when the object is not used anymore.

Parameters:
fdThe file descriptor containing the bitmap data to decode
outPaddingIf not NULL, return the padding rect for the bitmap if it exists, otherwise set padding to [-1,-1,-1,-1]. If no bitmap is returned (NULL) then padding is unchanged.
optsNULL-ok; Options that control downsampling and whether the image should be completely decoded, or just is size returned.
Returns:
The decoded bitmap, or NULL if the image data could not be decoded, or, if opts is non-NULL and requested only the size be returned (in opts's outWidth and opts's outHeight)
static Bitmap* gaia::graphics::BitmapFactory::decodeFileDescriptorN ( const storage::FileDescriptor &  fd) [static]

Decode a bitmap from the file descriptor.

If the bitmap cannot be decoded, the function returns NULL. The position within the descriptor will not be changed when this returns, so the descriptor can be used again as is.

The caller should delete the returned object to release the allocated memory when the object is not used anymore.

Parameters:
fdThe file descriptor containing the bitmap data to decode
Returns:
The decoded bitmap, or NULL if the image data could not be decoded, or, if opts is non-NULL and requested only the size be returned (in opts's outWidth and opts's outHeight)
static Bitmap* gaia::graphics::BitmapFactory::decodeFileN ( const base::String &  pathName,
Options *  opts 
) [static]

Decode a file path into a bitmap.

If the specified file name is NULL, or cannot be decoded into a bitmap, the function returns NULL.

The caller should delete the returned object to release the allocated memory when the object is not used anymore.

Parameters:
pathNamecomplete path name for the file to be decoded.
optsNULL-ok; Options that control downsampling and whether the image should be completely decoded, or just is size returned.
Returns:
The decoded bitmap, or NULL if the image data could not be decoded, or, if opts is non-NULL and requested only the size be returned (in opts's outWidth and opts's outHeight)
static Bitmap* gaia::graphics::BitmapFactory::decodeFileN ( const base::String &  pathName) [static]

Decode a file path into a bitmap.

If the specified file name is NULL, or cannot be decoded into a bitmap, the function returns NULL.

The caller should delete the returned object to release the allocated memory when the object is not used anymore.

Parameters:
pathNamecomplete path name for the file to be decoded.
Returns:
The decoded bitmap, or NULL if the image data could not be decoded
static Bitmap* gaia::graphics::BitmapFactory::decodeResourceN ( const content::Resources &  res,
int32_t  id,
Options *  opts 
) [static]

Synonym for opening the given resource and calling decodeResourceStreamN.

If the resource cannot be decoded into a bitmap, the function returns NULL.

The caller should delete the returned object to release the allocated memory when the object is not used anymore.

Parameters:
resThe resources object containing the image data
idThe resource id of the image data
optsNULL-ok; Options that control downsampling and whether the image should be completely decoded, or just is size returned.
Returns:
The decoded bitmap, or NULL if the image data could not be decoded, or, if opts is non-NULL and requested only the size be returned (in opts's outWidth and opts's outHeight)

int32_t  id 
) [static]

Synonym for decodeResourceN(const content::Resources&, int32_t, Options*) will NULL Options.

The caller should delete the returned object to release the allocated memory when the object is not used anymore.

Parameters:
resThe resources object containing the image data
idThe resource id of the image data
Returns:
The decoded bitmap, or NULL if the image data could not be decoded.
static Bitmap* gaia::graphics::BitmapFactory::decodeResourceStreamN ( const content::Resources &  res,
const core::TypedValue &  value,
const storage::InputStream &  is,
Rect *  pad,
Options *  opts 
) [static]

Decode a new Bitmap from an InputStream.

This InputStream was obtained from resources, which we pass to be able to scale the bitmap accordingly.

The caller should delete the returned object to release the allocated memory when the object is not used anymore.

Returns:
The decoded bitmap, or NULL if the image data could not be decoded, or, if opts is non-NULL and requested only the size be returned (in opts's outWidth and opts's outHeight)
static Bitmap* gaia::graphics::BitmapFactory::decodeStreamN ( const storage::InputStream &  is,
Rect *  outPadding,
Options *  opts 
) [static]

Decode an input stream into a bitmap.

If the input stream is NULL, or cannot be used to decode a bitmap, the functions returns NULL. The stream's position will be where ever it was after the encoded data was read.

The caller should delete the returned object to release the allocated memory when the object is not used anymore.

Parameters:
isThe input stream that holds the raw data to be decoded into a bitmap.
outPaddingIf not NULL, return the padding rect for the bitmap if it exists, otherwise set padding to [-1,-1,-1,-1]. If no bitmap is returned (NULL) then padding is unchanged.
optsNULL-ok; Options that control downsampling and whether the image should be completely decoded, or just is size returned.
Returns:
The decoded bitmap, or NULL if the image data could not be decoded, or, if opts is non-NULL and requested only the size be returned (in opts's outWidth and opts's outHeight)
static Bitmap* gaia::graphics::BitmapFactory::decodeStreamN ( const storage::InputStream &  is) [static]

Decode an input stream into a bitmap.

If the input stream is NULL, or cannot be used to decode a bitmap, the function returns NULL. The stream's position will be where ever it was after the encoded data was read.

The caller should delete the returned object to release the allocated memory when the object is not used anymore.

Parameters:
isThe input stream that holds the raw data to be decoded into a bitmap.
Returns:
The decoded bitmap, or NULL if the image data could not be decoded.
BitmapFactory& gaia::graphics::BitmapFactory::operator= ( const BitmapFactory &  src) [private]

Does not support copy constructor and assignment operator.
